About Myself

Hello! I'm Robin a researcher and student in computer science at Texas Tech University. I work on projects related to machine learning, attend hackathons, enjoy biking and playing guitar. I can be found on GitHub and LinkedIn. Take a look at my résumé and feel free to contact me.

Open GL based Game Engine

Research

Robin’s research project focuses on creation of a new exploratory tool for metagenomic data analysis. The core component of this tool is a new algorithm to measure polymorphic mutational frequencies adjacent to fixed mutations, which works via an integrated Java pipeline employing several existing algorithms to process raw genomic mutational data through steps such as assembly, blast matching, re-mapping, binning, and re-assembly. Ultimately, the tool will be tested and used to iteratively improve phasing of strains from complex cellular assemblages, allowing users to measure evolutionary forces and predict trajectories of infectious disease and cancer.

- Dr. Amanda M.V. Brown
